posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
For along time now I've been wanting a Paladin Sorc spellsword.  But every time I try and make one all I can see is major feat starvation.  From looking at the paladins spellbook it looks like they should compliment a spellsword nicely.

Goals:
1.  Full paladin spellbook
2.  Full Sorcerer spellbook
3.  Tumble class for skill dumps.

So the following is what I've been able to come up with.  

The downside's?

1.  Lower AB (fairly normal for a spellsword)
2.  No spell penetration feats
3.  No Blind fight.  (Though I'd be sorely tempted to exchange empower spell for blind fight.)
4.  No scribe scroll or craft wand
5.  EXP penalty from lvl 13 onward

Pro's
1.  Full paladin spellbook
2.  Epic Sorcerer
3.  Full Autostill.
4.  Divine Might and Shield with decent charisma to back it up (can also self buff charisma for better usage)

Out of curiosity, I made the same char with Fighter instead and ended up with like 7-8 more feats due to the  bonus feats.  And replacing with wizard gets more feats and skill points, but lower DS/DM due to gimped charisma.  This gal does meet all of my initial goals, so it isn't a complete loss.  But is there a way to make a decent pally/sorc? Does the paladin spellbook make up for the missing feats? or are they all gimped and thats why no one uses them....

Lawful Good, PVM

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Wait a minute, how do you get full Paladin spellbook with 8 wisdom?

Although it might be the lack of coffee yet on my part.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
You were correct.  I had deleted my original CBC sheet and then remade it.

I knew that Strength looked too high from what I had before...

Fixed it now though.  Course that also means that she lost 2 AB as well...    

Now's when you really feel the feat starvation...  no epic prowess to pick up one of the lost AB...


[Edit... Damn spellcheck...  replaced CBC (when lowercased with abc)    but capitalize everything and it leaves it alone...]

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hm, how about you delay slightly your first rogue level to 22nd in order to regain one of the lost AB?

And you could always replace rogue with monk, that would give you evasion right when you get it instead of waiting to 37th & "free" cleave is always a good thing.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I'm just throwing another idea here,

By starting with 15 charisma & 14 wisdom you can get the same final scores plus a "free" epic feat that you can use for epic prowess or blind fight.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I don't know if I'm just being dumb here, but won't a Sorcerer by its very nature be able to use magical devices? Unless the UMD is there for her to wear things like monk boots - in which case Valerfor's suggestion of taking Monk instead of Rogue makes even more sense, especially given the +2 to AC from WIS. Yes, she'd lose some skill points, but she wouldn't need UMD anyway

Talking of AC and armour more generally, given that she's not taking Automatic Still Spells until in the 30s, does this mean she'll be casting in robes and then donning her full plate before charging in until that time? I ask from a position of ignorance in these matters?

Cheers

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: I don't know if I'm just being dumb here, but won't a Sorcerer by its very nature be able to use magical devices? 
She will be able to use Wiz/Sorc items.   Unless you also play on WoG.  WoG has class specific scrolls.  So the UMD is there mainly to allow me to use any scroll/item I come across.

Switching to monk though isn't a bad idea, though if I do that I think i'd be real tempted to lose one more sorcerer level to grab that third monk level for the speed boost.  Until the Autostill feats kick in, she 
will mainly be using her spells stilled.  Though that can be server specific as well.  On WoG there is a set of armor with 0 Arcane Spell Failure.  Awesome gear for a spellsword like this, though the fire giants are not always willing to just hand it over without some intense negotiations.

In vanilla NWN, if a paladin, being a divine caster, can use cleric scrolls; then Stag is correct those points in UMD could be put elsewhere.  It would allow you to maximize taunt easily enough and have a few left over.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks conlaoch. Alas, I now have another question born of ignorance, sorry. If you gain that marvellous armour, do you still need the automatic still spell feats? Given the feat starvation, would any other feats be better? Admittedly, that would make it a WoG-specific build rather than a more generic one, but just wondering?

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Mithril shirt might exists but it doesn't quite give the AC of that best full plate, and that is coming only by getting those nice auto-still III feats ;)

Hope that helps.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: And what I will suggest now it won't make the build easier at all but I know that conlaoch wants that "craft wands" somewhere in this build...

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: Thanks conlaoch. Alas, I now have another question born of ignorance, sorry. If you gain that marvellous armour, do you still need the automatic still spell feats? Given the feat starvation, would any other feats be better? Admittedly, that would make it a WoG-specific build rather than a more generic one, but just wondering?

Cheers
Another good question Stag.

It would be possible to give those up.  Then I would just have to remove a shield to cast.  

But that all assumes you play on WoG.  For those that don't, the autostill feats will be nice.

hehe.... on WoG there is even a shield that has 0 ASF, but thats a bit harder to acquire...

And if I was to give up those feats, since they come so late in Epic, I'd most likely take

Epic Prowess
Epic Mage Armor
Epic Warding.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: And what I will suggest now it won't make the build easier at all but I know that conlaoch wants that "craft wands" somewhere in this build...
That sure would be nice.  And I tried honest...  but I didn't want to give up knockdown for craft wand.

Not sure which paladin spells can't be crafted into a wand, but that sure would give you a lot more firepower.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: I'm just throwing another idea here,

By starting with 15 charisma & 14 wisdom you can get the same final scores plus a "free" epic feat that you can use for epic prowess or blind fight.
Somehow missed this last night.

So by doing this and subbing monk for rogue gives us the following (also pushed monk to epic so gain another AB)....

So net effect is:
+2 AB
picked up Epic Prowess, evasion, and cleave
UMD gone as well, so if pally can't use cleric scrolls we're stuck with just Arcane scrolls.

posts.author: rangersg
posts.content: I'd use monk rather than rogue as well. That gives you access to the cool monk boots & robes, so the pain of missing out on UMD is virtually nil. You're already alignment locked to lawful good by paladin. Might as well get the most out of that wisdom. If you wanted to, you could even go Dexer for combat instead of STR, make yourself much more difficult to hit, and probably keep close to the same AC with monk gear (shields are legal with monk gear too). If you ran into something you couldn't damage with a normal Dex weapon, well that's what spells and smite are for.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
The problem with dexxers is usually the lack of damage.  I wonder if the Paladin buffs and the Sorcerer buffs would make up for this.  I'd still have to drop a feat though to pick up weapon finesse.  And I'm not seeing one that I could really give up.

I'll have to think of this a bit more though and maybe copy it into a new CBC sheet to see if there is a way to work it.  Might not be worth the loss to go dexxer.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I know this sounds counter-intuitive, but if the buffs work as you would hope for a Dexer, then the prime candidate for dropping would be Power Attack, I'd think. (And I must confess, I'd prefer Blind Fight to KD, but that's probably because I see one as a must have and the other as a should have. That's just personal preference.)

Also, and not wishing to re-open the old Discipline for Dexers debate, you might feel you could make better use of the skill points...or not...just a thought!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Can't drop it, I'm afraid, it is a pre-requisite for Divine might & shield...

Going Dexer will also force him to invest in yet another stat and he really can't afford that. See, he already needs 13+ strength for PA->DM->DS.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Ah...methinks I got a bit carried away here, sorry. Running before I can walk and all that (although the Abyss only knows why Power Attack should have any bearing on DM and DS - AD&D3 gods just being spiteful again, I guess).

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hey guys! Please allow me to pitch in and get a bit more technical.

I do like Monk better than Rogue for this build, but the WIS AC is NOT a factor, because you'll be wearing armor. So that part of Monk is basically moot, as is the attack progression and Flurry of Blows. What Monk does do for you is give you Concentration AND Discipline as class skills, which means you can move the 15th Paladin level pre-epic and get the max off of your buffs.

You won't have such low AB as you think, as long as you use your Paladin spellbook correctly. You'll have a +5 Longsword from pally 15, and A couple of Divine Favors to give you that extra boost in boss fights. What I truly don't understand and really seems weird to me is the chosen leveling order. Why would you be in such a hurry to take your Sorcerer levels? I do understand 1 level on WoG for True Strikes and a certain Robe you get that can make your life easier, but to be honest, I would play this one as a straight-up meleer for the first 14 levels. The pally buffs do make up for the lower stats, as it is something that most pallies suffer from. Then, at level 12 (after your GMW and DF have reached +4 each), and you have 12 BAB in the first 12 levels, you can start getting your character to lag behind without that much problem.

Stag, the reason you don't value KD as much probably has to do with the difficulty you've gotten used to facing. If you ever do play on WoG, I'm 100% sure you'll change your mind. There's no need to disable non-threatening enemies, but if a regular mob high-level Wizard could cast Time Stop, Mordenkainen's Disjunction, Time Stop, Greater Sanctuary, then buff up and beat the crap out of you, or cast Time Stop and Bigby 9 plus a bunch of IGMSs at you, you would understand that if you let certain enemies cast the first spell, you're in for a world of pain.

This is exactly what I meant when I said that you're shaped as a builder by the environments you face.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The sole reason for that late Paladin level Max is the "Taunt" skill.

That being said, if you drop "Taunt" entirely then you can put that late Paladin level pre-epic increasing the playability & early power of the build and most importantly you can drop Intelligence down to twelve, increasing your Charisma to sixteen. Why is that important, you said? Well, now we need one less Great attribute to round-off our stats and we can take at our eighteen sorcerer level "Epic Mage Armour" instead, which is a tremendous buff for this build! I like it!

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:The sole reason for that late Paladin level Max is the "Taunt" skill.

That being said, if you drop "Taunt" entirely then you can put that late Paladin level pre-epic increasing the playability & early power of the build and most importantly you can drop Intelligence down to twelve, increasing your Charisma to sixteen. Why is that important, you said? Well, now we need one less Great attribute to round-off our stats and we can take at our eighteen sorcerer level "Epic Mage Armour" instead, which is a tremendous buff for this build! I like it!
Hey Val! Exactly what I meant. Before, when he had Rogue, he needed Pal in epics to max out Discipline as well as Taunt. Taunting in this build would be more useful in pre-epic. When your Pal buffs haven't kicked in yet. After that, it's questionable to say the least. You can even fathom spending points on Taunt to help in pre-epic, but in epics it just won't make enough difference. So, perhaps a partial drop of Taunt is the best. Stop it at 20, if you must have it. Just so it gives you that extra boost in pre-epics, then just forget about it.

The most important side effect of going straight up pally for the first 12 levels is the 3 attacks per round right away. That makes a HUGE difference! Especially when fighting in melee is your main method of killing things.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Maximillian_Kane wrote:  What I truly don't understand and really seems weird to me is the chosen leveling order. Why would you be in such a hurry to take your Sorcerer levels? 
Main reason for the early sorcerer levels was for the second level and 3rd lvl sorcerer spell.  

Sorcerer level six gets me 3 haste, 2 flame weapon, 3 invis, and 6 true strikes  per rest.    known spells (4/321) castings per day (6/5/3).

And since I took still spell at lvl 1, its usable from the very beginning.

I could always drop empower spell for blindfight, but empower makes the sorcerer castings so much more flexible.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
conlaoch wrote:
Maximillian_Kane wrote:  What I truly don't understand and really seems weird to me is the chosen leveling order. Why would you be in such a hurry to take your Sorcerer levels? 
Main reason for the early sorcerer levels was for the second level and 3rd lvl sorcerer spell.  

Sorcerer level six gets me 3 haste, 2 flame weapon, 3 invis, and 6 true strikes  per rest.    known spells (4/321) castings per day (6/5/3).

And since I took still spell at lvl 1, its usable from the very beginning.

I could always drop empower spell for blindfight, but empower makes the sorcerer castings so much more flexible.
Although I understand that, I don't see how that would be useful for this build early on. I prefer going for it after Paladin 12. I know you play sneakily most of the time, but the way I see it, this is not a guy to play sneakily, this is a guy to play as a warrior with later casting prowess, because you need to build BAB for your later levels. Hasting a low AB 1-attack toon for 6 rounds is hardly going to be a game-changer. Hasting a 3-attack toon for 6 rounds buffed with Bless, Aid, GMW and Divine Favor will be AWESOME.

That's just my 2 cents.

EDIT: I would NEVER drop Empower on a Sorcerer build, EVER. You could memorize some Invisibility Purges or get Dusts of Appearance to counter invis'ed people.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Maximillian_Kane wrote: I would NEVER drop Empower on a Sorcerer build, EVER.
Truer words may have never be spoken, extend & empower are absolutely necessary to any serious caster build, in fact, those are the absolute minimum one should have.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
Maximillian_Kane wrote: I would NEVER drop Empower on a Sorcerer build, EVER.
Truer words may have never be spoken, extend & empower are absolutely necessary to any serious caster build, in fact, those are the absolute minimum one should have.
Myself personally, I never would either.

posts.author: rangersg
posts.content:
conlaoch wrote:
Valerfor wrote:
Maximillian_Kane wrote: I would NEVER drop Empower on a Sorcerer build, EVER.
Truer words may have never be spoken, extend & empower are absolutely necessary to any serious caster build, in fact, those are the absolute minimum one should have.
Myself personally, I never would either.
Thirded. Given that the sole benefit of a sorcerer over wizard is metamagic on the fly, gimping that advantage is counterproductive.
